indications: Tapeworms, roundworms and schistomiasis (used as a stand-alone herb)
Postpartum swelling of the hands and feet

contraindications: Excessive consumption clogs the Qi and blocks the diaphragm.

useCases: Parasites in patients showing signs of malnutrition

notes: This herb is a modern addition to the pharmacopia.
The pedicle of the plant is used for sores and burns.
Use 120 to 200g of Nan Gua Zi alone for schistosomiasis.

Usually 60-120g of powdered Nan Gua Zi is taken with water, followed two hours later by a decoction of 60-120g od Sm. Arecae #{BingLang} Bing Lang and thirty minutes later by 15g of Mirabilitum Mang Xiao taken with water.

Some sources say that this herb harmonizes the Stomach and Spleen, promotes the flow of Qi, kills intestinal parasites, nourishes and moistens, removes Heat and promotes urination to treat diabetes, cestodiasis, ascariasis and postpartum edema of the hands and feet.
One source says not to confuse Red Squash seed with Pumpkin seeds which treat prostatic hypertrophy.
